docs.title: Python/uv Projects
docs.text:
Reference: aiterm, nexus-cli

name: Tests

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, dev]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

permissions:
  contents: read
  checks: write

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-latest, macos-latest]
        python-version: ["3.10", "3.11", "3.12"]

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Install uv
        uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
        with:
          enable-cache: true
          cache-dependency-glob: "uv.lock"

      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        run: uv python install ${{ matrix.python-version }}

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: uv sync --all-extras --dev

      - name: Run tests with coverage
        run: uv run pytest --cov=<package> --cov-report=xml -v

      - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
        if: matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest' && matrix.python-version == '3.12'
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v4
        with:
          token: ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }}
          files: ./coverage.xml

Key features: - Multi-platform (Ubuntu + macOS) - Multi-Python version matrix - uv for fast dependency management - Codecov integration

docs.title: Example Workflow
docs.text:
Creates .github/workflows/publish.yml:

name: Publish to PyPI

on:
  release:
    types: [published]

jobs:
  publish:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: pypi  # Required for trusted publishing
    permissions:
      id-token: write  # Required for OIDC
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.x'
      - name: Build package
        run: |
          python -m pip install build
          python -m build
      - name: Publish to PyPI
        uses: pypa/gh-action-pypi-publish@release/v1

docs.title: What It Creates
docs.text:
Generates install.sh:

#!/bin/bash
# Quick installer for myapp

set -e

# Detect platform
if [[ "$OSTYPE" == "darwin"* ]]; then
  # macOS - use Homebrew
  brew install user/tap/myapp
elif command -v pip &> /dev/null; then
  # Python available - use PyPI
  pip install myapp
else
  # Fallback - download binary
  curl -sSL https://github.com/user/repo/releases/latest/download/myapp > /usr/local/bin/myapp
  chmod +x /usr/local/bin/myapp
fi

docs.text:
Claude Code discovers plugins through:

Component Purpose Marketplace local-plugins registered at ~/.claude/local-marketplace Registry ~/.claude/plugins/installed_plugins.json tracks versions Cache ~/.claude/plugins/cache/local-plugins/craft/<version>/ stores loaded files

docs.title: Updating After Homebrew Upgrade
docs.text: When you run brew upgrade craft, Homebrew updates the files and the post-install hook automatically syncs the plugin registry.

docs.title: Automatic Sync (v1.18.0+)
docs.text:
The formula's post_install hook runs: 

claude plugin update craft@local-plugins

This happens automatically after each upgrade. Just restart Claude Code to load the new version.

docs.title: Manual Sync (if needed)
docs.text:
If automatic sync fails (Claude CLI not available, etc.):

claude plugin update craft@local-plugins

This command: 1. Reads from the symlink (→ new Homebrew version) 2. Copies files to Claude Code cache 3. Updates the registry with new version

docs.title: Verify Update
docs.text:
# Check registry version
cat ~/.claude/plugins/installed_plugins.json | jq '.plugins["craft@local-plugins"][0].version'

# Should match Homebrew version
brew info craft | head -1

docs.title: Auto-Enable Skipped
docs.text:
Symptom: Message says "Claude Code is running - skipped auto-enable"

Cause: The installer detected Claude Code has settings.json open and skipped modification to avoid conflicts.

Fix: 

claude plugin install craft@local-plugins

This is expected behavior when installing while Claude Code is running.

docs.title: Installation Hangs (Pre-v1.18.0 only)
docs.text:
Symptom: brew install or brew upgrade hangs during post-install

Cause: Older formula versions attempted to modify settings.json without checking for Claude.

Fix (if stuck now): 

# Find and kill the stuck process
ps aux | grep craft-install
kill <PID>

# Then manually enable
claude plugin install craft@local-plugins

Prevention: Upgrade to latest formula: brew update && brew reinstall data-wise/tap/craft

docs.title: Plugin Not Loading
docs.text:
Symptom: /craft:hub not recognized after install

Fix: 

# Re-run install script
craft-install

# Or manually create symlink
ln -sf /opt/homebrew/opt/craft/libexec ~/.claude/plugins/craft

# Update registry
claude plugin update craft@local-plugins

# Restart Claude Code

docs.title: Version Mismatch
docs.text:
Symptom: Registry shows old version after brew upgrade

Fix: 

claude plugin update craft@local-plugins

docs.title: Symlink Permission Denied
docs.text:
Symptom: ln: failed to create symbolic link

Fix: 

# Remove existing directory/symlink
rm -rf ~/.claude/plugins/craft

# Create fresh symlink
ln -s /opt/homebrew/opt/craft/libexec ~/.claude/plugins/craft

docs.title: Cache Cleanup
docs.text:
Symptom: Multiple old versions accumulating

Fix: 

# List cached versions
ls ~/.claude/plugins/cache/local-plugins/craft/

# Remove old versions (keep current)
rm -rf ~/.claude/plugins/cache/local-plugins/craft/1.16.0
rm -rf ~/.claude/plugins/cache/local-plugins/craft/1.6.0-dev

name: Validate Plugin

on:

jobs:
  validate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

            exit 1
          fi

      - name: Validate command files

          for f in commands/**/*.md; do

          done

docs.title: DO
docs.text:
• Keep worktrees outside project folder (~/.git-worktrees/)
  • Use consistent naming (project/branch-name)
  • Install deps after creating worktree

  • Use different ports for dev servers (PORT=3001 npm run dev)

docs.title: DON'T
docs.text:
• Create worktrees inside the project folder
  • Switch branches within a worktree (defeats the purpose!)
  • Forget to install dependencies
  • Leave stale worktrees around (use clean)

docs.title: Git Feature Development Workflow
docs.text: Scenario: Developing a new feature with proper isolation using worktrees and PR workflow Time: 15-30 minutes Difficulty: 🔧 Medium

docs.title: When to Use This Workflow
docs.text:
Use this workflow when you need to:

  • Add a new feature to the codebase
  • Work on isolated changes without affecting dev
  • Collaborate via pull requests
  • Work on multiple features simultaneously

Example scenarios: - "I need to add user authentication" - "Working on feature X while fixing bug Y" - "Starting a new increment of work"

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before starting, ensure you have:

  • [x] Git configured with remote
  • [x] On dev branch and up to date
  • [x] Worktree folder created (/craft:git:worktree setup)

Quick check: 

git branch --show-current  # Should be: dev
git status                 # Should be: clean
git fetch origin dev && git log HEAD..origin/dev --oneline  # Should be empty

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
flowchart LR
    A[1. Plan on dev] --> B[2. Create worktree]
    B --> C[3. Implement]
    C --> D[4. Test & validate]
    D --> E[5. Create PR]
    E --> F[6. Cleanup]

docs.title: Step 1: Plan on dev
docs.text:
Analyze requirements and get approval before coding.

# Ensure you're on dev and up to date
git checkout dev
git pull origin dev

# Analyze, plan, discuss
# Do NOT write feature code here

Key rule: Never write feature code directly on dev.

docs.title: Step 2: Create Worktree
docs.text:
Create an isolated workspace for your feature.

# Using Craft command (recommended)
/craft:git:worktree create feature/my-feature

# This does:
# 1. Creates ~/.git-worktrees/project/my-feature
# 2. Creates branch feature/my-feature from dev
# 3. Checks out the branch in the worktree

# Navigate to worktree
cd ~/.git-worktrees/craft/my-feature

Output: 

╭─ Worktree Created ─────────────────────────────────────╮
│ Branch: feature/my-feature                             │
│ Location: ~/.git-worktrees/craft/my-feature            │
│ Based on: dev                                          │
├────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ Next: cd ~/.git-worktrees/craft/my-feature             │
╰────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

docs.title: Step 3: Implement with Atomic Commits
docs.text:
Write code with small, focused commits.

# Use Conventional Commits
git commit -m "feat: add user model"
git commit -m "feat: add auth endpoints"
git commit -m "test: add auth tests"
git commit -m "docs: add auth documentation"

Commit types: | Prefix | Use for | |--------|---------| | feat: | New features | | fix: | Bug fixes | | refactor: | Code changes that don't add features or fix bugs | | test: | Adding or updating tests | | docs: | Documentation only | | chore: | Maintenance tasks |

docs.title: Step 4: Test & Validate
docs.text:
Run checks before creating PR.

# Run pre-flight check
/craft:check --for pr

# Or manually:
python3 tests/test_craft_plugin.py  # Tests
./scripts/validate-counts.sh         # Validation

# Rebase onto latest dev
git fetch origin dev
git rebase origin/dev

docs.title: Step 5: Create PR
docs.text:
Push and create pull request.

# Push branch
git push -u origin feature/my-feature

# Create PR to dev
gh pr create --base dev --title "feat: add authentication" --body "## Summary
- Add user model and auth endpoints
- Add tests and documentation

## Test plan
- [x] All tests pass
- [x] Manual testing completed
"

docs.title: Step 6: Cleanup
docs.text:
After PR is merged, clean up the worktree.

# Remove worktree
git worktree remove ~/.git-worktrees/craft/my-feature

# Delete local branch
git branch -d feature/my-feature

# Or use Craft command to clean all merged branches
/craft:git:clean

docs.title: Hotfix (from main)
docs.text:
For urgent fixes that need to go directly to production:

# Create hotfix from main
git checkout main
/craft:git:worktree create hotfix/critical-fix

# Fix, test, PR to main
cd ~/.git-worktrees/craft/critical-fix
# ... make fix ...
/craft:check --for pr
gh pr create --base main --title "fix: critical issue"

# After merge, cherry-pick to dev if needed
git checkout dev
git cherry-pick <commit-hash>

docs.title: Quick Fix (no worktree)
docs.text:
For trivial fixes that don't need isolation:

# Stay on dev, make small fix
git checkout dev
git checkout -b fix/typo
# ... fix ...
git commit -m "fix: typo in README"
git push -u origin fix/typo
gh pr create --base dev

docs.title: Release (dev → main)
docs.text:
When ready to release:

# Create release PR
git checkout dev
gh pr create --base main --head dev --title "Release v1.18.0"

# After merge, tag the release
git checkout main
git pull
git tag v1.18.0
git push --tags

docs.text: Issue Solution "Worktree already exists" git worktree remove <path> or use different name Rebase conflicts git rebase --abort && git merge origin/dev Branch not up to date git fetch origin dev && git rebase origin/dev Orphaned worktrees git worktree prune Can't delete branch Check if worktree still exists for that branch

docs.title: Pre-commit Workflow
docs.text: Scenario: Validating changes before committing to ensure code quality Time: 1-5 minutes Difficulty: 🟢 Beginner

docs.title: When to Use This Workflow
docs.text:
Use this workflow when you:

  • Finish a coding session and want to commit
  • Need to validate changes before pushing
  • Want to catch issues before CI runs
  • Are preparing code for review

Example scenarios: - "Ready to commit my changes" - "Want to make sure everything works before pushing" - "Need to validate before creating a PR"

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before starting, ensure you have:

  • [x] Changes staged or ready to stage
  • [x] On a feature branch (not main/dev)
  • [x] Tests exist for the project

Quick check: 

git status
git branch --show-current

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
flowchart LR
    A[1. Review changes] --> B[2. Run checks]
    B --> C{Pass?}
    C -->|Yes| D[3. Commit]
    C -->|No| E[4. Fix issues]
    E --> B
    D --> F[5. Push]

docs.title: Step 1: Review Changes
docs.text:
See what you're about to commit.

# Check status
git status

# Review diff
git diff

# Or with craft
/craft:git:recap

Look for: - Unintended file changes - Debug code or console.log statements - Sensitive data (API keys, passwords) - Large files that shouldn't be committed

docs.title: Step 2: Run Pre-commit Checks
docs.text:
Use craft to validate everything.

# Quick validation
/craft:check

# Or for more thorough check
/craft:check --for commit

What it checks: | Check | Description | |-------|-------------| | Lint | Code style and quality | | Tests | Run test suite | | Types | Type checking (if applicable) | | Git status | Working tree status |

Expected output: 

╭─ /craft:check ───────────────────────────────────────╮
│ Project: craft (Claude Plugin)                       │
│ Time: 12.4s                                          │
├──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ ✓ Lint         0 issues                              │
│ ✓ Tests        89/89 passed                          │
│ ✓ Git          37 files changed                      │
├──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ STATUS: ALL CHECKS PASSED ✓                          │
╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

docs.title: Step 3: Commit Changes
docs.text:
If checks pass, commit with a descriptive message.

# Stage changes
git add .

# Or stage specific files
git add src/ tests/

# Commit with conventional commit message
git commit -m "feat: add user authentication"

Conventional Commits: | Prefix | Use for | |--------|---------| | feat: | New features | | fix: | Bug fixes | | docs: | Documentation only | | refactor: | Code changes that don't add features or fix bugs | | test: | Adding or updating tests | | chore: | Maintenance tasks |

docs.title: Step 4: Fix Issues (if needed)
docs.text:
If checks fail, fix the issues and re-run.

# Auto-fix lint issues
/craft:code:lint --fix

# Re-run tests to see failures
/craft:test:run debug

# Re-run checks
/craft:check

docs.title: Step 5: Push Changes
docs.text:
After successful commit, push to remote.

git push origin feature/my-feature

docs.title: Quick One-Liner
docs.text:
For experienced users, the entire flow in one sequence:

# Check, stage, commit, push
/craft:check && git add . && git commit -m "feat: description" && git push

docs.title: Pre-commit Hooks (Optional)
docs.text: Set up automatic checks before every commit.

docs.title: Using pre-commit framework (Python)
docs.text:
# Install pre-commit
pip install pre-commit

# Create .pre-commit-config.yaml
cat > .pre-commit-config.yaml << 'EOF'
repos:
  - repo: https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff-pre-commit
    rev: v0.1.6
    hooks:
      - id: ruff
        args: [--fix]
      - id: ruff-format

  - repo: https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit-hooks
    rev: v4.5.0
    hooks:
      - id: trailing-whitespace
      - id: end-of-file-fixer
      - id: check-yaml
      - id: check-added-large-files
EOF

# Install hooks
pre-commit install

docs.title: Using husky (Node.js)
docs.text:
# Install husky
npm install --save-dev husky

# Initialize
npx husky init

# Add pre-commit hook
echo "npm test" > .husky/pre-commit

docs.title: Quick Commit (Skip Extensive Checks)
docs.text:
For trivial changes where you trust the code:

# Just lint check
/craft:code:lint

# Commit if clean
git add . && git commit -m "fix: typo in README"

docs.title: Pre-PR Commit
docs.text:
More thorough validation before creating a PR:

# Full PR checks
/craft:check --for pr

# Includes:
# - Lint + tests
# - Coverage threshold
# - Branch up to date
# - No merge conflicts

docs.title: Amend Last Commit
docs.text:
Fix the last commit without creating a new one:

# Stage additional changes
git add .

# Amend (only if not pushed!)
git commit --amend --no-edit

# Or with new message
git commit --amend -m "feat: better description"

docs.text: Issue Solution Lint errors Run /craft:code:lint --fix Test failures Run /craft:test:run debug for details Large file warning Add to .gitignore or use Git LFS Sensitive data Remove and add to .gitignore Wrong branch git stash && git checkout correct-branch && git stash pop

docs.title: Release Workflow
docs.text: Scenario: Preparing and publishing a new version release Time: 30-60 minutes Difficulty: 🔧 Medium

docs.title: When to Use This Workflow
docs.text:
Use this workflow when you need to:

  • Release a new version to production
  • Publish to package registries (npm, PyPI, CRAN)
  • Create GitHub releases with changelogs
  • Deploy documentation updates

Example scenarios: - "Ready to release v1.18.0" - "Need to publish the latest fixes" - "Time for a major version bump"

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before starting, ensure you have:

  • [x] All tests passing on dev branch
  • [x] Changelog updated
  • [x] Version bumped in config files
  • [x] Documentation up to date
  • [x] No uncommitted changes

Quick check: 

/craft:check --for release

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
flowchart LR
    A[1. Pre-release audit] --> B[2. Version bump]
    B --> C[3. Update changelog]
    C --> D[4. Create release PR]
    D --> E[5. Merge & tag]
    E --> F[6. Publish]

docs.title: Step 1: Pre-Release Audit
docs.text:
Run comprehensive checks before releasing.

/craft:check --for release

What it checks: | Check | Description | |-------|-------------| | Tests | Full test suite with coverage | | Lint | All rules, security checks | | Types | Full type checking | | Security | Vulnerability audit | | Docs | Link validation | | Changelog | Recent entries |

Expected output: 

╭─ /craft:check --for release ─────────────────────────╮
│ Project: craft (Claude Plugin)                       │
│ Time: 2m 34s                                         │
├──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ ✓ Lint         0 issues                              │
│ ✓ Tests        89/89 passed                          │
│ ✓ Security     0 vulnerabilities                     │
│ ✓ Docs         All links valid                       │
│ ✓ Changelog    Updated within 7 days                 │
├──────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│ STATUS: READY FOR RELEASE ✓                          │
╰──────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯

docs.title: Step 2: Version Bump
docs.text:
Update version numbers in all relevant files.

# Check current version
cat .claude-plugin/plugin.json | grep version

# Update version (manual or scripted)
# - .claude-plugin/plugin.json
# - pyproject.toml (if Python)
# - package.json (if Node)
# - DESCRIPTION (if R)

Version format: Follow Semantic Versioning - MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH - 1.18.0 → 1.18.1 (patch/bugfix) - 1.18.0 → 1.19.0 (minor/feature) - 1.18.0 → 2.0.0 (major/breaking)

docs.title: Step 3: Update Changelog
docs.text:
Add release notes to CHANGELOG.md.

/craft:docs:changelog

Changelog format: 

## [1.18.0] - 2026-01-14

### Added
- Help pages for key commands
- Release and pre-commit workflow docs
- Navigation updates to mkdocs.yml

### Changed
- Updated command count to 89

### Fixed
- Broken links in workflow documentation

docs.title: Step 4: Create Release PR
docs.text:
Merge dev branch to main via pull request.

# Ensure dev is up to date
git checkout dev
git pull origin dev

# Create release PR
gh pr create --base main --head dev \
  --title "Release v1.18.0" \
  --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
Release v1.18.0 with documentation improvements.

## Changes
- Add help pages for key commands
- Add release and pre-commit workflow docs
- Update navigation in mkdocs.yml

## Checklist
- [x] All tests pass
- [x] Changelog updated
- [x] Version bumped
- [x] Documentation complete
EOF
)"

docs.title: Step 5: Merge & Tag
docs.text:
After PR approval, merge and create release tag.

# Merge PR (via GitHub UI or CLI)
gh pr merge --merge

# Switch to main and pull
git checkout main
git pull origin main

# Create and push tag
git tag v1.18.0
git push --tags

docs.title: Step 6: Publish
docs.text: Publish to relevant registries.

docs.title: PyPI (Python)
docs.text:
# Automatic via GitHub Actions if configured

uv build
uv publish

docs.text:
gh release create v1.18.0 \
  --title "v1.18.0" \
  --notes-file CHANGELOG.md \
  --latest

/craft:site:deploy

mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Hotfix Release
docs.text:
For urgent fixes that bypass normal dev flow:

# Create hotfix branch from main
git checkout main
git checkout -b hotfix/critical-fix

# Fix, test, commit
/craft:check --for release

# PR directly to main
gh pr create --base main --title "hotfix: critical fix"

# After merge, cherry-pick to dev
git checkout dev
git cherry-pick <commit-hash>
git push origin dev

docs.title: Pre-release (Beta/RC)
docs.text:
For testing before full release:

# Tag with pre-release identifier
git tag v1.18.0-beta.1
git push --tags

# Create pre-release on GitHub
gh release create v1.18.0-beta.1 \
  --title "v1.18.0 Beta 1" \
  --prerelease

docs.title: Automated Release
docs.text:
Using GitHub Actions:

name: Release

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - 'v*'

jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Create Release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v1
        with:
          generate_release_notes: true
